metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1283 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Apache httpd 2.4.0 to 2.4.29, when mod_session is configured to forward its session data to CGI applications (SessionEnv on, not the default), a remote user may influence their content by using a "Session" header. This comes from the "HTTP_SESSION" variable name used by mod_session to forward its data to CGIs, since the prefix "HTTP_" is also used by the Apache HTTP Server to pass HTTP header fields, per CGI specifications.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1').
